Class Sprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • Sprite

  • public class Sprite
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates a group of images as a single data structure for managing an animation. This class has an array list of AnimFrame objects which it cycles through, each AnimFrame having a specific duration. When the last AnimFrame in the ArrayList has been cycled through, this class's currFrameIndex member variable is set to 0 and the process begins again.

    The class itself merely tracks the state of this process, a ledger for determining what to display when. For a Sprite object to implement the actual animations, the class must be updated and accessed periodically by some sort of timed iterative process.

    In the case of the program Whack-a-Prof, this is handled in the Barker class's Barker.runMainProgramLoop() which has a loop that iterates as long as a flag is true but takes a brief sleep after every iteration to establish a persistent frame rate.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Sprite()
      Constructs a new ArrayList for the AnimFrame objects, sets the total duration of this Sprite object's animation sequence to zero, sets the current position in the animation to zero, and the current frame to zero.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sprite

        public Sprite()
        Constructs a new ArrayList for the AnimFrame objects, sets the total duration of this Sprite object's animation sequence to zero, sets the current position in the animation to zero, and the current frame to zero.

    • Method Detail

      • addFrame

        public void addFrame(java.awt.Image image,
                     long duration)
        This method is used to add a new AnimFrame to this Sprite object's animation sequence. The image and duration of the AnimFrame are determined by the two parameters passed.
        Parameters:
        image - the image that is to be displayed for the frame
        duration - the amount of time the frame persists for during the animation sequence

      • start

        public void start()
        Sets the animation time and current frame index to 0.

      • update

        public void update(long elapsedTime)
        This method is used to update the position in the animation and the frame this Sprite is on. This method is to be used in conjunction with some sort of sequentially organized and likely periodic process in order to display the animation.
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - the amount of time that has passed since the last iteration

      • getImage

        public java.awt.Image getImage()
        Returns:
        returns the current image the Sprite is on as indicated by the currFrameIndex member variable.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns:
        returns the width of the image of the current frame

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns:
        returns the height of the image of the current frame

      • getTotalDuration

        public long getTotalDuration()
        Returns:
        returns how long the entire animation sequence runs for
